ul.li: JTest- Very nice with tons of features, but also very expensive and requires a running X server (or Xvfb) to run on Linux. They charge $500 to move a license from one machine to another.
DoctorJ - Written in C++, checks Javadoc, syntax and calculates metrics.
JLint - Written in C++, does lots of synchronization checks.
JNP - Nifty research project, uses JJTree/JavaCC.
Checkstyle - Very detailed, supports both Maven and Ant.
JCSC - Does a variety of coding standard checks, uses JavaCC and the GNU Regexp package.
